A **short sword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"). [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") know the short sword as a **wakizashi**.

[ ]

## Generation

[Human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") have a 1⁄2 chance of starting the game with a short sword as their one-handed weapon.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") start the game with a short sword as their primary weapon, and Samurai start the game with a short sword as their offhand weapon.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The short sword makes up about 0.8% of randomly generated weapons.

Several monsters can [generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") short swords:

- [Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army") [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja") have a 3⁄4 chance of generating with a short sword.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- [Chieftains](/wiki/Chieftain "Chieftain"), [pages](/wiki/Page "Page"), [roshi](/wiki/Roshi "Roshi"), and [warriors](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) [Hunters](/wiki/Hunter "Hunter") have a 2⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
- [Skeletons](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton") have an effective 1⁄12 chance of generating with a short sword.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
- [Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements[\[9\]](#cite_note-9) player monster [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)") have a 1⁄4 chance of forcing a short sword as their primary weapon.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

## Short sword skill

| Short sword |                                                                                                                                                  |
| ----------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max         | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                        |
| Basic       | - [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                            |
| Skilled     | * [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")                                        |
| Expert      | - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") |

The following weapons use the short sword skill:

- short sword
- [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword")
- [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword")
- [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword")

All short swords weigh 30 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") and have a base price of 10 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"). There are no [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") short swords.

## Strategy

The short sword can be decent as an offhand weapon for early [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweaponing "Twoweaponing"), but is generally outclassed by [long swords](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") and similar weapons. A Samurai's [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana") in particular is typically used as an offhand weapon once they obtain an artifact weapon.

## History

The short sword first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"), which introduces the Samurai, [Elf](/wiki/Elf_\(role\) "Elf (role)") and [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja_\(role\) "Ninja (role)") roles. From this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), all Elves start the game with a short sword - from [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") to [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3"), the Elf instead starts with an elven short sword if the TOLKIEN [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") is enabled.

The Samurai's starting short sword first appears in [NetHack 2.2a](/wiki/NetHack_2.2a "NetHack 2.2a"), while the Rogue's starting short sword is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 (where it replaces the Ninja role).

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds the [silver short sword](/wiki/Silver_short_sword "Silver short sword") and [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)") as weapons that use the short sword skill.

Four artifact weapons use the short sword skill:

- [Quick Blade](/wiki/Quick_Blade "Quick Blade") (elven short sword)
- [Luckblade](/wiki/Luckblade "Luckblade") (short sword)
- [The Sword of Balance](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Balance "The Sword of Balance") (silver short sword)
- [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade") (orcish short sword)

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword, and upgrading an orcish short sword will produce a short sword.

A [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster that is not strong and has a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its [monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") will have a chance of generating with a short sword, unless they are being generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"): the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") or [nasty](/wiki/Nasty "Nasty"), 1⁄10 for a monster that is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[\[11\]](#cite_note-default-11)

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") adds the silver short sword as a weapon that uses the short sword skill.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") add the [droven short sword](/wiki/Droven_short_sword "Droven short sword") and [mirrorblade](/wiki/Mirrorblade "Mirrorblade") as weapons that use the short sword skill, and the [wakizashi](/index.php?title=Wakizashi_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wakizashi (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") is made into a separate weapon from the standard short sword. All short sword weapons can be [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison").

[Enki](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Enki.2C_God_of_the_First_City "Spirits (dNetHack)") is a spirit that grants skill in short swords while bound.

There are a few artifacts that use the short sword skill:

- [Luck Blade](/wiki/Luck_Blade "Luck Blade") is a chaotic [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict")-favoring short sword that acts as the role's first sacrifice gift. It has +1d7 to-hit and deals +1d7 damage versus all monsters, uses [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")-based damage dice, and acts as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") while carried.
- [Spineseeker](/wiki/Spineseeker_\(dNetHack\) "Spineseeker (dNetHack)") is a chaotic short sword that has +1 to-hit and deals +1d6 damage versus all monsters. It grants [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") while wielded and adds extra damage dice for sneak attacks and [backstabs](/wiki/Backstab "Backstab"), making sneak attacks available to non-[Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") roles.
- [Lolth's Fang](/wiki/DNetHack#Lolth.27s_Fang "DNetHack") is an intelligent [drow-favoring](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") [silvered](/wiki/Silver "Silver") droven short sword that acts as the [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift for chaotic and neutral drow. It has +1d5 to-hit and deals +1d10 [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage against non-resistant monsters, is permanently poisoned, and adds extra damage dice for sneak attacks. Lolth's Fang also grants [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while wielded.
- [Avarice](/wiki/DNetHack#Avarice "DNetHack") is an intelligent lawful large-sized short sword wielded by [Mammon](/wiki/Mammon "Mammon"). It has +1d10 to-hit and deals +1 damage, stealing items from targets that it hits.
- [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") is a [silvered](/wiki/Silver "Silver") long sword made of [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") that uses (and trains) the higher of the two between the character's short sword and long sword skills.
- [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") can generate in short sword form.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Fire and Frost Brand use the short sword as their [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") instead of [long swords](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds the [gladius](/wiki/Gladius "Gladius") as a weapon that uses the short sword skill.

Two short swords can be combined at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create a long sword.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds the [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)") as a weapon that uses the short sword skill, which is significantly different from its implementation in SLASH'EM.

Soldiers and watchmen that do not have a race-specific short sword may generate with a short sword. [Agents](/wiki/Agent "Agent") of the [gods](/wiki/God "God") have a 3⁄4 chance of generating with a short sword. Player monster [barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian_\(player_monster\) "Barbarian (player monster)") and giant and tortle player [samurai](/wiki/Samurai_\(player_monster\) "Samurai (player monster)") generate with short swords.

A short sword can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") and 2 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"). Short swords can be used to create several items:

- A short sword can be combined with a [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear") to create a dwarvish short sword.
- A short sword can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar").
- A short sword can be combined with a scimitar to create a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword").
- Two short sword can be combined to create a long sword.
- A short sword can be combined with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") to create a [glaive](/wiki/Glaive "Glaive").

As in xNetHack, Fire Brand and Frost Brand are changed to short swords.

### Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds the gladius from SpliceHack as a weapon that uses the short sword skill, and retains the artifacts from SLASH'EM that use the skill.

Upgrading a short sword will produce an elven short sword, and upgrading an orcish short sword will produce a short sword.

In addition to forging recipes from EvilHack, a short sword can be combined with a broadsword to create a gladius.

## Encyclopedia entry

### Wazikashi

A wakizashi was used as a samurai's weapon when the katana  
was unavailable. When entering a building, a samurai would  
leave his katana on a rack near the entrance. However, the  
wakizashi would be worn at all times, and therefore, it made  
a sidearm for the samurai (similar to a soldier's use of a  
pistol). The samurai would have worn it from the time they  
awoke to the time they went to sleep. In earlier periods,  
and especially during times of civil wars, a tanto was worn  
in place of a wakizashi.

\[ Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia ]

A short sword is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a one-handed melee weapon made of iron. Samurai know the short sword as a wakizashi.

Generation

Human Barbarians have a 1⁄2 chance of starting the game with a short sword as their one-handed weapon.[1] Rogues start the game with a short sword as their primary weapon, and Samurai start the game with a short sword as their offhand weapon.[2][3]

The short sword makes up about 0.8% of randomly generated weapons.

Several monsters can generate with short swords:

  • Watchmen and Yendorian army soldiers have an effective 1⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[4]
  • Ninja have a 3⁄4 chance of generating with a short sword.[5]
  • Chieftains, pages, roshi, and warriors have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[6] Hunters have a 2⁄3 chance of generating with a short sword.[7]
  • Skeletons have an effective 1⁄12 chance of generating with a short sword.[8]
  • Player monsters, including those on the Astral Plane, have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements[9] player monster rogues have a 1⁄4 chance of forcing a short sword as their primary weapon.[10]

The short sword first appears in NetHack 1.3d, which introduces the Samurai, Elf and Ninja roles. The Samurai's starting short sword first appears in NetHack 2.2a, while the Rogue's starting short sword is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 (where it replaces the Ninja role).

SLASH'EM adds the silver short sword and dark elven short sword as weapons that use the short sword skill.

  • Luckblade (short sword)
  • The Sword of Balance (silver short sword)
  • Doomblade (orcish short sword)

  • Spineseeker is a chaotic short sword that has +1 to-hit and deals +1d6 damage versus all monsters. It grants stealth while wielded and adds extra damage dice for sneak attacks and backstabs, making sneak attacks available to non-Rogue roles.

A '''short sword''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a one-handed [[melee]] weapon made of [[iron]]. [[Samurai]] know the short sword as a '''wakizashi'''.

==Generation==
[[Human (starting race)|Human]] [[Barbarian]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of starting the game with a short sword as their one-handed weapon.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|43|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Rogue]]s start the game with a short sword as their primary weapon, and Samurai start the game with a short sword as their offhand weapon.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|124|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|135|nethack=3.6.7}}

The short sword makes up about 0.8% of randomly generated weapons.

Several monsters can [[Monster starting inventory|generate with]] short swords:
* [[Watchmen]] and [[Yendorian army]] [[soldier]]s have an effective {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|197|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2|3}} chance of not getting a [[polearm]]}}
* [[Ninja]] have a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating with a short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|268|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* [[Chieftain]]s, [[page]]s, [[roshi]], and [[warrior]]s have a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|292|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Hunter]]s have a {{frac|2|3}} chance of generating with a short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|304|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* [[Skeleton]]s have an effective {{frac|12}} chance of generating with a short sword.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|480|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Skeletons are the only [[Zombie (monster class)|zombie]] [[monster class]] member eligible to generate with weapons and armor}}
* [[Player monster]]s, including those on the [[Astral Plane]], have a chance lower than 1% of generating with a short sword as their initial weapon before role-based replacements{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|155|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds}} player monster [[Rogue (player monster)|rogues]] have a {{frac|4}} chance of forcing a short sword as their primary weapon.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|230|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Short sword skill==
{{short sword skill table}}

The following weapons use the short sword skill:

* short sword
* [[dwarvish short sword]]
* [[elven short sword]]
* [[orcish short sword]]

All short swords weigh 30 [[aum]] and have a base price of 10 [[zorkmid]]s. There are no [[artifact weapon|artifact]] short swords.

==Strategy==
The short sword can be decent as an offhand weapon for early [[twoweaponing]], but is generally outclassed by [[long sword]]s and similar weapons. A Samurai's [[katana]] in particular is typically used as an offhand weapon once they obtain an artifact weapon.

==History==
The short sword first appears in [[NetHack 1.3d]], which introduces the Samurai, [[Elf (role)|Elf]] and [[Ninja (role)|Ninja]] roles. From this version to [[NetHack 2.3e]], all Elves start the game with a short sword - from [[NetHack 3.0.0]] to [[NetHack 3.2.3]], the Elf instead starts with an elven short sword if the TOLKIEN [[compile-time option]] is enabled.

The Samurai's starting short sword first appears in [[NetHack 2.2a]], while the Rogue's starting short sword is introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 (where it replaces the Ninja role).

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds the [[silver short sword]] and [[Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)|dark elven short sword]] as weapons that use the short sword skill.

Four artifact weapons use the short sword skill:

* [[Quick Blade]] (elven short sword)
* [[Luckblade]] (short sword)
* [[The Sword of Balance]] (silver short sword)
* [[Doomblade]] (orcish short sword)

[[Upgrading]] a short sword will produce a dwarvish short sword, and upgrading an orcish short sword will produce a short sword.

A [[humanoid]] monster that is not strong and has a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its [[monster starting inventory]] will have a chance of generating with a short sword, unless they are being generated on the [[Rogue level]]: the base odds are {{frac|14}} for normal monsters, {{frac|12}} for a monster that is a [[M2 LORD|lord]] or [[nasty]], {{frac|10}} for a monster that is an [[M2_PRINCE|overlord]] or both a lord and nasty, and {{frac|8}} for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.{{refsrc|makemon.c|203|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2|name="default"|comment=Default set of cases for monster weapon generation in SLASH'EM}}

===SporkHack===
[[SporkHack]] adds the silver short sword as a weapon that uses the short sword skill.

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]] add the [[droven short sword]] and [[mirrorblade]] as weapons that use the short sword skill, and the [[Wakizashi (dNetHack)|wakizashi]] is made into a separate weapon from the standard short sword. All short sword weapons can be [[poison]]ed.

[[Spirits (dNetHack)#Enki, God of the First City|Enki]] is a spirit that grants skill in short swords while bound.

There are a few artifacts that use the short sword skill:

* [[Luck Blade]] is a chaotic [[Convict]]-favoring short sword that acts as the role's first sacrifice gift. It has +1d7 to-hit and deals +1d7 damage versus all monsters, uses [[luck]]-based damage dice, and acts as a [[luckstone]] while carried.
* [[Spineseeker (dNetHack)|Spineseeker]] is a chaotic short sword that has +1 to-hit and deals +1d6 damage versus all monsters. It grants [[stealth]] while wielded and adds extra damage dice for sneak attacks and [[backstab]]s, making sneak attacks available to non-[[Rogue]] roles.
* [[dNetHack#Lolth's Fang|Lolth's Fang]] is an intelligent [[Drow (starting race)|drow-favoring]] [[silver]]ed droven short sword that acts as the [[crowning]] gift for chaotic and neutral drow. It has +1d5 to-hit and deals +1d10 [[acid]] damage against non-resistant monsters, is permanently poisoned, and adds extra damage dice for sneak attacks. Lolth's Fang also grants [[drain resistance]] while wielded.
* [[dNetHack#Avarice|Avarice]] is an intelligent lawful large-sized short sword wielded by [[Mammon]]. It has +1d10 to-hit and deals +1 damage, stealing items from targets that it hits.
* [[Sunsword]] is a [[silver]]ed long sword made of [[gold]] that uses (and trains) the higher of the two between the character's short sword and long sword skills.
* [[Fire Brand]] and [[Frost Brand]] can generate in short sword form.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], Fire and Frost Brand use the short sword as their [[base item]] instead of [[long sword]]s.

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds the [[gladius]] as a weapon that uses the short sword skill.

Two short swords can be combined at a [[furnace]] to create a long sword.

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds the [[Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)|dark elven short sword]] as a weapon that uses the short sword skill, which is significantly different from its implementation in SLASH'EM.

Soldiers and watchmen that do not have a race-specific short sword may generate with a short sword. [[Agent]]s of the [[god]]s have a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating with a short sword. Player monster [[Barbarian (player monster)|barbarians]] and giant and tortle player [[Samurai (player monster)|samurai]] generate with short swords.

A short sword can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[dagger]] and 2 [[crossbow bolt]]s. Short swords can be used to create several items:

* A short sword can be combined with a [[dwarvish spear]] to create a dwarvish short sword.
* A short sword can be combined with a [[knife]] to create a [[scimitar]].
* A short sword can be combined with a scimitar to create a [[broadsword]].
* Two short sword can be combined to create a long sword.
* A short sword can be combined with a [[spear]] to create a [[glaive]].

As in xNetHack, Fire Brand and Frost Brand are changed to short swords.

===Hack'EM===
Hack'EM adds the gladius from SpliceHack as a weapon that uses the short sword skill, and retains the artifacts from SLASH'EM that use the skill.

Upgrading a short sword will produce an elven short sword, and upgrading an orcish short sword will produce a short sword.

In addition to forging recipes from EvilHack, a short sword can be combined with a broadsword to create a gladius.

==Encyclopedia entry==
===Wazikashi===
{{encyclopedia|
A wakizashi was used as a samurai's weapon when the katana
was unavailable.  When entering a building, a samurai would
leave his katana on a rack near the entrance.  However, the
wakizashi would be worn at all times, and therefore, it made
a sidearm for the samurai (similar to a soldier's use of a
pistol).  The samurai would have worn it from the time they
awoke to the time they went to sleep.  In earlier periods,
and especially during times of civil wars, a tanto was worn
in place of a wakizashi.
|[ Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia ]
}}
